metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40745 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibTIFF is vulnerable to an integer overflow. This flaw allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute an arbitrary code via a crafted tiff image, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm9
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm9
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm9
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm9').
